item.title: Strings and Regular Expressions in Python
item.description: library(reticulate) #Strings A string in Python is a list of unicode characters in a particular order. These character sequences can include any combination of numbers, letters, and/or non-alphanumeric characters (i.e.Â backslashes, puncuation marks, spaces). All of the following can be considered strings. string1="abcdefg" string2 = "abc 1,2,3" string3 = "Hi my name is Hallie and I was born on February 25, 1998 at 2:25 (on 2/25 at 2:25). Cool right!
